title: 107_hr2903
content: The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2001" is cited as the short title. It introduces an exclusion for gain from stock of small, publicly traded companies in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2001" excludes gain from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The exclusion is limited to $100,000 ($50,000 for married individuals filing separately). 1203 stock refers to stock in a qualified small business C corporation acquired after the enactment date, either for money, property, or as compensation for services. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2001" excludes gain from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The exclusion is limited to $100,000 ($50,000 for married individuals filing separately). 1203 stock refers to stock in a qualified small business C corporation acquired after the enactment date, either for money, property, or as compensation for services provided to the corporation. The qualified small business must be publicly traded on a recognized stock exchange or market. The market capitalization of a corporation or its predecessor must not exceed $150,000,000 at the time of stock acquisition. Market capitalization is calculated by multiplying the closing stock price by the number of outstanding shares. The reporting period for determining stock acquisition is based on the most recent annual or quarterly report filed with the SEC. Aggregation rules similar to section 1202(d)(3) apply for calculating market capitalization. Rules similar to section 1202 shall apply for determining stock acquisition, with adjustments in subsection (j)(1)(A) and exclusion of sales and exchanges under section 1202 for this section. Conforming amendments are made to sections 642(c)(4) and 643(a)(3) of the Code. Section 643(a)(3) and 691(c)(4) of the Code are amended to include section 1203 in addition to 1202. Section 871(a)(2) is also amended to include both sections. Section 1044(d) now includes reference to 1203. A new subsection is added to section 1202 regarding sales and exchanges under section 1203. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. Subchapter P of chapter 1 of the Code is amended to include a new item after section 1202. Sec. 1203 provides an exclusion for gain from stock of small, publicly traded companies. The amendments made by this section apply to securities acquired after the date of the enactment of this Act.
